message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.MA 

Reasoning: The paper discusses decision-making and control in the context of resource costs and information costs, which are relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. The use of a thermodynamic interpretation suggests a connection to information theory (cs.IT), while the focus on bounded rationality and optimal control suggests connections to artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), and control systems (cs.SY). The mention of stochastic policies and risk-sensitive control also suggests a connection to multi-agent systems (cs.MA).
